question_sentence: The trial of former Minneapolis police officer Derek Chauvin is well underway. Which of these statements was NOT said in the trial by a witness?
choices: “He looked terrified and scared, begging for his life.”
“Just because they're speaking doesn't mean they're breathing adequately.”
“I thought he was saying, ‘I ate too many drugs.’”

question_sentence: Which NCAA team captured the men’s basketball title this week?
Which rare skin condition ISN’T a reaction to the COVID-19 vaccine?
Tiger Woods hit the brake in an attempt to avoid the February car crash that severely injured his right leg. True or false?
Which of these corporations has NOT spoken out about the controversial Georgia voting bill?
Tony-nominated actor Paul Ritter died this week at age 54. Which film franchise did he appear in?
Which film's cast won for Best Ensemble Cast at the SAG Awards?
Donald Trump dropped by how many spots on Forbes’ billionaire rankings during his presidency?
Restaurants and fast-food chains are facing a possible pandemic-related shortage of which popular condiment?
All U.S. adults will be eligible to receive a COVID-19 vaccine by when, according to President Joe Biden?
Which South American country is seeing a rapid rise in Covid infections, despite leading the continent in terms of its vaccine rollout?
In which European capital are talks to revive the Iran nuclear deal taking place?
Modelling by University College London has contradicted a study by the Office for National Statistics by suggesting that the UK could reach herd immunity by what date?
What is the name of the Ukrainian president who has been thrown into frantic diplomatic activity after the build up of Russian forces on its southwestern border?
Twitter held talks to buy which social media platform in a deal reported to have been worth around $4bn (£2.9bn)?
The massacre of almost 200 Tigrayans by troops in which African nation have given rise to fears of genocide?
A Welsh man is searching for two people who “posted” him home inside a crate from which country in 1965?
Global clinical trials are under way for a Covid vaccine produced inside which animal’s eggs using a method currently used to manufacture influenza vaccines?
Film fans have the opportunity to get their hands on the iconic mansion from which classic movie after it was listed for sale at $89.75m (£64.7m)?
A report by which international advocacy organisation has accused the UK of “abandoning” human rights?
Which world leader signed a law effectively allowing him to run for two more terms, a move that would extend his decades-long grip on power?
evidence: Currently serving in his fourth term, Russian President Vladimir Putin signed a change to the country’s constitution, potentially extending his rule until 2036.

question_sentence: According to CDC Director Dr. Rochelle Walensky, which coronavirus variant has officially taken over as the most prevalent variant of the virus in the United States?
evidence: The UK coronavirus variant, technically known as B.1.1.7, has emerged as the most dominant variant in the US, now found in all 50 states.

question_sentence: Prince Philip, husband to Queen Elizabeth II, passed away at 99. What was his noble title?
evidence: Prince Philip, Duke of Edinburgh married Queen Elizabeth II — then Princess Elizabeth — in 1947, making him the longest-serving British consort.

question_sentence: Which Grammy award-winning artist is and donating $1 million to help Ethiopians amid ongoing violence in the war-torn country?
evidence: The Weeknd, whose real name is Abel Makkonen Tesfaye, announced that he’ll make the donation to Ethiopian relief efforts through the UN World Food Programme. Many estimate that thousands of civilians have been killed in the country’s months-old conflict.

question_sentence: Tensions and violence are rising once again in this part of the UK between unionists and nationalists along so-called “peace lines,” symbolic borders that effectively separate two communities.
evidence: The latest wave of violence in Northern Ireland is a result of Brexit-related tensions and unionist-related anger over authorities deciding not to prosecute leaders of the nationalist party Sinn Fein for allegedly breaking coronavirus restriction during a funeral.

question_sentence: In a video posted on Easter Sunday to his Twitter account, what did President Joe Biden say was a “moral obligation” for the country?
evidence: In addition to Easter well-wishes, President Biden, alongside First Lady Dr. Jill Biden, encouraged Americans to get a Covid-19 vaccine, saying it “can save your life and the lives of others.”

question_sentence: Which country conducted military drills on the west and east of Taiwan this week, an action that many experts consider a warning to the self-ruled island?
evidence: China conducted the drills, claiming it was simply a “routine training exercise.” Analysts say it was a warning to the island as well as the United States, one of Taiwan’s largest supporters.

question_sentence: In a nail-biting 54-53 victory, which team won this year’s NCAA Women’s College Basketball Tournament?
evidence: The Stanford Cardinal beat the Arizona Wildcats, claiming their first national title since 1992.

question_sentence: A Houston woman named Ayanna Williams made news after finally cutting what world-record-setting body part for the first time in 30 years?
evidence: After one final measurement at 24ft, 0.7 in long, Williams had her fingernails filed down, the first time doing so since the early 1990’s. Williams n the Guinness World Record for world’s longest fingernails in 2017.

question_sentence: Starbucks is running low on which popular new product less than a month after it was introduced to US stores?
evidence: Starbucks is dealing with an oat milk shortage at several stores, causing frustration for consumers nationwide that have grown fond of the chain’s oat milk-based drinks in recent months.
